Step-by-Step Guide

Get Started with JobHunter

Everything you need to know to set up your profile, configure AI, and start generating smart answers on any job application.

On this page

InstallationCreate an AccountSet Up Your ProfileConfigure AI ProviderUsing Smart AnswersUsing @ShortcutsResume ManagementDashboard OverviewTips & Tricks

Installation

1

Visit the Chrome Web Store listing for JobHunter (or load the unpacked extension from the GitHub repo for development).

2

Click Add to Chrome and confirm the permissions dialog.

3

The JobHunter icon () will appear in your browser toolbar. Click it to open the popup.

4

Pin the extension for quick access — click the puzzle-piece icon in the toolbar, then the pin next to JobHunter.

Developer Mode: To load unpacked, go to chrome://extensions, enable Developer Mode, click "Load unpacked", and select the extension/dist folder.

Create an Account

1

Open the extension popup and click Login / Register, or visit the registration page directly.

2

Enter your email and a secure password, then click Register.

3

You'll be automatically logged in and redirected to the dashboard. Your session syncs with the extension.

Set Up Your Profile

A complete profile is the foundation for great AI answers. The more context you provide, the better the generated responses.

Personal Information

Fill in your name, email, phone, location, and social links (LinkedIn, GitHub, portfolio). These are also used by @shortcuts.

Work Experience

Add your work history with company name, title, dates, and bullet-point descriptions. The AI uses these to craft experience-specific answers.

Education

Add degrees, institutions, graduation dates, and relevant coursework or achievements.

Skills

Use the autocomplete skills input to add technical and soft skills. The AI references these when answering "what skills do you bring" type questions.

Custom Q&A

Pre-write answers to common questions like "Why are you looking for a new role?" or "What's your biggest weakness?". The AI uses TF-IDF matching to find the most relevant saved answer and blend it with job-specific context.

Pro tip: Write 10-15 custom Q&A pairs covering the most common application questions. This dramatically improves AI answer quality.

Configure AI Provider

JobHunter supports multiple AI providers. Choose the one that works best for you:

OpenRouter (Recommended)

Free Tier Available

Aggregates 100+ models including free tier options. Best for getting started — no credit card required.

OpenAI

Paid

GPT-4o and GPT-4o-mini. Reliable and fast. Requires an API key with billing enabled.

Anthropic

Paid

Claude Sonnet and Haiku models. Excellent at following formatting instructions.

Local LLM (Ollama)

Free / Self-hosted

Run models locally for complete privacy. Requires Ollama installed and running.

1

Go to the extension's Options page (right-click icon → Options).

2

Select your preferred AI provider and paste your API key.

3

Choose a model (or leave as default for OpenRouter Auto).

Using Smart Answers

1

Navigate to any job application page on a supported platform (Lever, Greenhouse, Workday, Wellfound, Ashby, SmartRecruiters, or any site).

2

JobHunter automatically detects text fields and injects a ✨ Generate Answer button next to each question.

3

Click the button. The AI reads the question, company info, job description, and your profile, then generates a tailored answer.

4

The answer is automatically inserted into the field. Review, edit if needed, and submit your application!

Character limits: JobHunter automatically detects character limits from the form (maxlength attributes and counter text). The AI respects these limits, and answers are truncated at sentence boundaries if needed.
Clean output: All AI responses are automatically stripped of markdown formatting, bullet points, citations, and other artifacts. You get clean, plain-text answers ready for submission.

Using @Shortcuts

The @shortcut system lets you instantly fill any input field with data from your profile — no AI needed. Just type @ to trigger the dropdown.

1

Click on any text input or textarea on a job application page.

2

Type @. A floating dropdown appears with all available shortcuts.

3

Type to filter (e.g., @lin shows @linkedin), or use ↑↓ arrow keys to navigate.

4

Press Enter or click to insert the value. The @ text is replaced with the actual data.

All Available Shortcuts

@emailYour email address
@phonePhone number
@fullnameFull name (First + Last)
@linkedinLinkedIn profile URL
@githubGitHub profile URL
@portfolioPortfolio / personal site
@websiteWebsite URL
@cityCurrent city
@stateCurrent state / province
@countryCountry
@locationFull location (City, State, Country)
@companyCurrent / most recent company
@titleCurrent / most recent job title
@schoolMost recent school
@degreeMost recent degree
@skillsComma-separated skills list
@summaryProfessional summary

Resume Management

1

Go to the Resume tab in your dashboard profile page.

2

Drag and drop a PDF or click to browse. Your resume is uploaded and stored securely.

3

You can view, download, or delete your uploaded resume from the same tab.

Keep your resume updated — the AI uses your profile data (not the resume file itself) for generating answers, so make sure your profile matches your latest resume.

Dashboard Overview

The web dashboard is your command center for managing everything:

Profile

Personal info, experience, education, skills — 6 organized tabs

Q&A Library

Save and manage custom question-answer pairs for AI context

Resume

Upload, view, and manage your resume files

Profile Preview

See how your profile looks with a beautiful gradient card

Settings

Configure AI provider, API keys, and extension preferences

Open Dashboard

Tips & Tricks

Write detailed experience descriptions

The AI pulls from your profile. More detail = better answers. Include specific technologies, metrics, and achievements.

Save 10-15 custom Q&A pairs

Common questions like "Why this role?", "Biggest weakness?", "Salary expectations?" — having pre-written answers dramatically improves quality.

Review before submitting

AI-generated answers are a starting point. Always review, personalize, and make them sound like you before submitting.

Use @shortcuts for speed

For simple fields like email, phone, LinkedIn — use @shortcuts instead of Smart Answers. They're instant and don't use AI credits.

Try OpenRouter for free

OpenRouter offers free-tier models. Set your provider to OpenRouter and use the "openrouter/auto" model to get started without any cost.

Button not appearing?

Try refreshing the page or clicking the extension icon. The extension re-scans for form fields. If the issue persists, the site may use a non-standard form structure.

Ready to start?

Install the extension and land your next interview faster.

Install JobHunter
